description: Latin sistō (“I bring to a stand, stop”).

entries.meaning: (law, Scotland) a stay or suspension of proceedings
examples: Fourteen Days are only allowed for Sists of Execution, from the Date the Bill was signed, for the Clerks inquiring in the Condition of the Cautioner  […]

verbs.description: sist (third-person singular simple present sists, present participle sisting, simple past and past participle sisted)

entries.meaning: (law, Scotland) To stay (e.g. judicial proceedings); to delay or suspend; to stop
(law, Scotland) to cause to take a place, as at the bar of a court; hence, to cite; to summon; to bring into court
examples: Some, however, have preposterously sisted nature as the first or generative principle.
